results.title: A Case for handling
results.creator_credit: Peter M Plaskitt, Humphrey Swingler and Greenpark Productions
results.brief_description: Under the guidance of a consultant, a foundry adopts numerous materials-handling devices; as a result of speeding the flow of castings from one point to another and using now redundant labourers on productive semi-skilled tasks, output increased by 20%. Although mainly concerned with the re-conversion of one factory, the film shows a wide range of materials-handling methods in other industries, including the use of cranes, lifting blocks, runways, conveyors, unit loads, palletization etc.

results.title: A Career in nursing
results.brief_description:
Presents an overview of nursing training in Australia and gives a general outline of what is involved in each of the three years of training required for qualifications as a nursing sister. Points out avenuyes open after qualification.
NB: Out of date information.

results.title: A Career in commercial television
results.creator_credit: Tony Wellington and Artransa Park Studios
results.brief_description: Looks at the administrative, engineering and production aspects of commercial television, concentrating in particular on production. Stresses the limited opportunities available in this field and how most people in production commence work at the bottom rung of the production ladder. Narrated by Roger Climpson. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: A Career in accountancy
results.creator_credit: Richard Wallace, Garry Blackledge and Artransa Park Studios
results.brief_description: Looks at three young people working in the field of accountancy and notes their reasons for choosing accountancy as a career as well as the range of options open to them. Also considers the role played by the Australian Society of Accountants. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: A Call from Malaysia
results.creator_credit: Gilbert Lauzun and United Nations Television
results.brief_description: We follow the efforts of a young Sarawak villager as he learns to participate in broadcasting, telephony, aviation and other modern occupations required in Malaysia (1967). Six million people living on countless islands and one large peninsula are now united in the Federation of Malaysia and the agencies of the United Nations are at work helping them build a modern and effective country.

results.title: A Burn's best friend
results.creator_credit: British Petroleum and St John Ambulance Australia
results.brief_description: This film deals with burns caused by sun, chemicals, steam and fire, stressing that COLD WATER is the best first aid treatment where injury is susceptible to infection. It explains the medical principle behind this treatment.

results.title: A British trade union
results.creator_credit: Anvil Films and British Information Services
results.brief_description: An account of the work of a shop steward in a furniture factory is used to illustrate how a British trade union functions. The film gives a comprehensive outline of union organisation, explaining the relationship between employees and their union and between the union, at several levels, and the employers.

results.title: A Brief history of astronomy
results.creator_credit: Manitoba Museum of Man and Nature and McGraw-Hill Films
results.brief_description: An animated film tracing humankind’s appreciation of the universe, from the earliest interest in the sun and sky, throughout history to our present knowledge of modern astronomy. Reviews the ideas of great thinkers and philosophers like Ptolemy, Copernicus, Tycho Brahe, Kepler, Galileo and Newtown.

results.title: A Bridge of friendship
results.brief_description: The 6th Boy Scout Jamboree held at Lansdowne, Sydney, 1960-1961, from the initial planning to the closing ceremony. Scouts from all over the world came for fifteen days, rigging tents, cooking, exchanging badges, singing around the campfire. Shows the march through Sydney and the visits of the Governor-General and other notable people.

results.title: A Boys' winter games lesson
results.creator_credit: Andrew Miller Jones and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description: This film shows a typical organised field games lesson for a class of boys aged 11 from an elementary school in a congested area of a big city. The lesson includes Association football and Rugby Touch, together with group practices leading up to these games. Based on British Board of Education Syllabus of Physical Training for Schools, 1933.
